alert.note: Alert for Granville; Vance (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 2:01PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Vance and northeastern Granville Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 201 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Oxford. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stovall, Tungsten and John H Kerr Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
